result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul D Wright

records.addlTxt: Defense counsel filed motion to suppress and requested motion hearing; defense received discovery but no offer. Case scheduled for motion hearing for January 27, 2023 at 10:00 am; both parties agreed to date and time. State to respond to motion by January 13, 2023.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-16-2022
Received and Filed. Motion to Suppress

Defendant Paul D Wright in court with Attorney Tyler David Rasmussen; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Dey. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-2-2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 7-05-2022

Attorney Tyler David Rasmussen in court, defendant Paul D Wright not in court, in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is taken under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 060264,
Payable Number: 1016746,
Receipt Number: 22RP026461,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Paul D Wright in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Paul D Wright in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
